instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2850 Restart when shutdown in OSX
threads.message:
Hi,
This is a clean board. No liquid damaged. It can turn off by pressing power button. How ever when it shutsdown from osx restarts.

SMC_ONOFF_L is 3.3and when shutdown goes to 0v and back 3.3 as usual.

Any idea?

threads.title: 820-2850 Restart when shutdown in OSX
threads.message:
Did you try PRAM reset?

Also try known good USB OSX, disocnnecting internal HDD/SSD.
Don't forget to test without battery too.

threads.title: 820-2850 Restart when shutdown in OSX
threads.message: Hi I tried with kown good USB OSX and did pram reset. Tried different rams one ram slot at a time battery disconnected. Still restart when shutdown from osx but can shutdown pressing the power button.

threads.title: 820-2850 Restart when shutdown in OSX
threads.message: I notice one thing to shutdown from the power button need to hold for 5 second  to turn off. if i press the power button for 2,3 seconds it restarts.

threads.title: 820-2850 Restart when shutdown in OSX
threads.message: Also tried  with  different macbook, and L?B out of the body connecting external monitor usb mouse and usb osx. still same

threads.title: 820-2850 Restart when shutdown in OSX
threads.message:
Also RTC  rails are normal


RTC_RESET_L:3.3V
PCH_SRTCRST_L: 3.3V
PCH_INTRUDER_L:3.0V
PCH_INTVRMEN: 3.3V

threads.title: 820-2850 Restart when shutdown in OSX
threads.message: HI Info, This is SOLVED. I noticeed PCIE_WAKE_L was going down to 1.9v after couple of seconds. check resisters all good. Replaced U3900 SOLVED. Thank you very mcuh for your help. See you until nest time I trouble you.:D

threads.title: 820-2850 Restart when shutdown in OSX
threads.message: Thanks for feedback, this can help someone else...
